info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 10:37PM EDT until October 27 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Broward.
* WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1037 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Plantation, Tamarac, Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Lauderhill, Oakland Park, Lauderdale Lakes, Wilton Manors, Lazy Lake, Golden Heights, Twin Lakes, Franklin Park, Washington Park, Downtown Fort Lauderdale, St. George, Melrose Park, Village Park, Rock Island, Roosevelt Gardens and West Ken-Lark. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT MONDAY
